result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theron J Haas

defendant.name: Haas, Theron J
defendant.address: 405 Crestwood St., Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead to Count 1 15CF203, amended without use of a dangerous weapon. 15CM150, Count 2.  Domestic DC.  Balance of counts  in 15CF203 and 15CM150, as well as all counts in 16CF94 and 15CM72 are dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Defense waived the reading of the amended information filed in 15CF203.  Defendant plead no contest.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given to the defendant by the Court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense and defendant stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Substantial Battery in 15CF203, contrary to 940.19(2) and Domestic Disorderly Conduct in 15CM150, contrary to 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a)1.  Joint recommendation for:  probation, 3 years.  No contact witth the victims, including his child. M.J., unless his agent approves and she requests.  No contact with his other children, unless approved by his agent and  his social worker.  D.H., T.H., Jr.,  ATH, RAH.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Submit to a mental health evaluation, if his agent recommends.  Comply with current mental health treatment and not to terminate without his agent's approval.   DNA sample and surcharge.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 year probation, concurrent.   No contact witth the victims, including his child, D.H. No contact with M.J., unless his agent approves, only for the purposes of child placement,  and she requests.  No contact with his other children ( T.H., Jr.,  ATH, RAH.), unless approved by his agent, his social worker and A.H.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. AODA and recommended treatment.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Submit to a mental health evaluation, if his agent recommends.  Comply and follow through with current mental health treatment with the VA, and not to terminate without his agent's approval.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Court reviewed charges and potential penalties on 15CM72.  Defendant understands.  He wishes to waive counsel.  After he completed the waiver of counsel form Judge reviewed with him.  She made a clarification on the form regarding anger classes.  Finds defendant freely, knowingly, and intelligently waived his right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty.  State indicates there has been no response from the victim yet and requests the case be set for ptc ad stc dates.  Court set pretrial for 7-1-15 and status on 7-13-15 at 3:00.
